column1: Severe Lower Back Pain from Kidney Stones
column2: AZNJ, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given Toradol for kidney stone pain because I could not tolerate the narcotic alternative. My first dose was given in the ER by injection and I was given a prescription for 20 pills, max 4/day for 5 days. I took a total of 12 pills only as needed until the kidney stone was removed the following week. Two weeks after the injection, i passed out, went to the ER, hemoglobin was 4.5  due to a severe gastro bleed. I spent 13 hrs in the ER and the 5 days in ICU. Received 7 units of blood, had endoscopy to clip off gastro bleeders and the Interventional Radioloqgy to plug the last bleeder.  How do I know it was the Toradol that caused this? When the doctor was taking my history and I told him about the kidney stone, the next words out of his mouth were "Did they give you Toradol for the pain?"

column9: I went into the ER for a UTI, normally I refuse any pain meds but we were taking a plane back home..well out two week vacation turned into five weeks and I almost lost my life. less then a minute after the injections, I got a severe headache, the most pain Ive ever felt in my life, I passed out briefly and on the fall to the exam table I vomitted and inhaled the stomach acids, causing my lungs to start bleeding. My heart couldn't keep up and it stopped and efforts were made to save my legs. I spent the next week in critical condition sedated with a machine breathing for me. It was the most hellish thing I have ever been through..I'm a 23 year old female with no prior substantial medical conditions..Further tests showed that there was no natural cause of this happening to me meaning It wouldn't have unless I took this drug. column9: Flank pain & bloated feeling in the groin area left within a few minutes. I subsequently passed the stone the next day with no further pain.

column9: Although this drug controlled my pain, it caused me to have horrific nightmares.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I received Toradol after my 2nd operation for ventricular-peritoneal shunt.  Toradol controlled my pain BEAUTIFULLY.  After my 1st ventricular-peritoneal shunt, I had been given narcotics which did not work that well.
